ru.jango.j0widget.camera.fragment

Class AbstractCameraFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • ru.jango.j0widget.camera.fragment.AbstractCameraFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.hardware.Camera.PictureCallback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleCameraFragment

    public abstract class AbstractCameraFragment
extends Fragment
implements android.hardware.Camera.PictureCallback
    Base fragment for managing CameraPreview. Creates layout, does basic configurations, cares for basic camera trouble - monkey users Oo See setTakePictureFrequency(int).

        public int getTakePictureFrequency()
        Returns min acceptable time between taking photos in milliseconds.

      • getPictureSize

        public android.graphics.Point getPictureSize()
        After taking photo, it would be automatically rotated and scaled down and then passed into SimpleCameraFragment.CameraFragmentListener.onProcessingFinished(java.net.URI, byte[], android.graphics.Bitmap).

      • setPictureSize

        public void setPictureSize(android.graphics.Point size)
        After taking photo, it would be automatically rotated and scaled down and then passed into SimpleCameraFragment.CameraFragmentListener.onProcessingFinished(java.net.URI, byte[], android.graphics.Bitmap).

      • shouldRestartOnResume

        public boolean shouldRestartOnResume()

      • openCamera

        protected void openCamera()
        Place, where Camera object is obtained and configured. Reload it for more configurations.

      • getRotation

        protected int getRotation()
        Returns angle in degrees that taken picture should be rotated by.

      • cooldownOk

        protected boolean cooldownOk()
        Checks if the cooldown have passed. Protection against macaque.
        See Also:
        setTakePictureFrequency(int)

      • startPreview

        public void startPreview()
        Opens a Camera and passes it into CameraPreview

      • stopPreview

        public void stopPreview()
        Stops preview and releases Camera.

      • restartPreview

        public void restartPreview()
        Restarts preview. Stops preview correctly, releases resources, than grabs resources back and starts preview again.

        NOTE: calling stopPreview() and than startPreview() is NOT the same and may fail.

      • canTakePicture

        public boolean canTakePicture()
        Checks if photo can be taken at the moment. It could not, because:
        • cooldown has not passed yet (setTakePictureFrequency(int))

      • takePicture

        public boolean takePicture()
        Starts taking photo process. It could fail if canTakePicture() returns FALSE.
        Returns:
        TRUE, if taking photo process have actually began
